meanings.definition: To cause to feel strange or uncomfortable.
meanings.sent1: The spooky movie weirded me out.
meanings.sent3: The talking cat weirded out the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence weirded the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious fog weirded the forest.

meanings.sent1: The old clock weirded over time.
meanings.sent2: The painting weirded as it aged.
meanings.sent3: The banana weirded into a different shape.
meanings.sent4: The sky weirded with swirling colors.
meanings.sent5: The potion weirded into a bubbling mess.
